answers.answer: Talk to your boss and see if u can take a few breaks but also let your Dr know and see if they can request u have breaks or if it looks to bad go ahead and go on leave

It can't hurt to talk to your boss about your options.  Maybe they have a way for you to work shorter days? Let them know, so they know you're in pain.  It really sucked but with my first I had to quit my job halfway through my pregnancy because I was so sick I could rarely make it in (I ended up having preeclampsia). Talk to your doctor too, but I feel like they will probably just tell you to listen to your body and take frequent breaks.

I'd talk to your doctor.  You have a long way to go with this pregnancy, I wonder why you are hurting so much.  Usually we aren't that uncomfortable at 21 weeks (more so than we are when we aren't pregnant standing for 10 hours).  If you can cut your hours, that would be great but tread lightly because some employers can be jerks and fire someone when pregnant.  They give other reasons but we all know why they really did it.I just don't want you to lose your job.  It's a matter of this maybe not being a good match of a job for you but it's hard to find another job at 21 weeks.But then again, if your boss is super understanding and nice, see about cutting hours.  ??  Okay, rambling.  I just want you to have your job if you need it@

I'd recommend calling your labor board to see what your rights are before talking to your boss. It's best to know your rights going into the situation because it is illegal to fire a pregnant person. It would also help your case if heaven forbid you do get fired, that there is a written record in place with the labor board about your pregnancy concerns.
